Marronnier Park

Tourist attractions that are good to look around together

Bukchon Korean-style house Village

33 minutes' walk from Hyoja snack bar, 15 minutes' drive

Located between Gyeongbokgung Palace, Changdeokgung Palace and Jongmyo Shrine, Seoul's representative traditional residential area is concentrated with traditional hanoks

Seoul City Wall Street

9 minutes' walk from Waryong Park, 2 minutes' drive

The capital of the Joseon Dynasty surrounding Seoul

Gyeongbokgung Palace

10 minutes' walk from Gwanghwamun Square, 9 minutes' drive

It is the central palace of the Joseon Dynasty, and the first royal palace built in the 4th year of King Taejo (1395) after moving the capital to Hanyang

Geunjeongjeon

14 minutes' walk from Gwanghwamun Square, 7 minutes' drive

It is the central building of Gyeongbokgung Palace, the royal palace of the Joseon Dynasty, where servants greeted the king with New Year's greetings, held national ceremonies, and greeted foreign envoys

Cheonggyecheon Stream

5 minutes' walk from Bosingak Pavilion. 5 minutes' drive

It is a 10.84km stream that separates Jongno-gu and Jung-gu in the middle of Seoul

Insa-dong Culture Street

17 minutes' walk from Bosingak Pavilion, 10 minutes' drive

One of the representative streets of Seoul where you can experience Korean traditional culture by connecting Jongno 2-ga, Jongno-gu, Seoul, Songhyeon-dong, and Anguk-dong

Gwangjang Market

26 minutes walk from Bosingak Pavilion, 12 minutes' drive

Located in Jongno 5-ga, Yeji-dong, Jongno-gu, Seoul, it is the largest traditional market in Seoul and the first traditional trading market in Korea

Heunginjimun Gate

24 minutes' walk from Marronnier Park, 17 minutes' drive

Heunginjimun Gate is the east gate of the eight gates of the fortress, which was built to protect the Hanseongbu with important national facilities
